comments: Perfect, if you're interested in learning Hebrew.
If you have any interest in understanding the Bible in its original language and literary medium, take this course.

if you're interested in the subject matter, take it. if you might be interested in the subject matter, shop it. either way, hands down the best course I have taken at Harvard, best taught, best organized, best pace, best instructor (Jonathan Kline). period.
The class is extremely rewarding and really gives one the ability to grapple with the original text of the Bible.

best course I have ever taken, in any department, with any teacher, any class, any semester, at harvard or anywhere else. ever. if you're willing to put in the time, he (Jonathan Kline) WILL teach you and he'll do a heck of a job. You will learn, you will know the material, you will appreciate the language, and most of all you will wish that every professor you had was half as good as Jonathan Kline. it was a letdown going to my other classes each week and having to deal with teaching that was so mediocre compared to his teaching.

Biblical Hebrew is a great language, and I would strongly recommend this class to anyone interested in learning it. You work a lot with actual biblical text along with other exercises, and all of it together is a very solid introduction to the language.
Good, comprehensive (but not overly technical) introduction to reading the Biblical text.

This is a great course to take if you would like to read the bible in the original language. I've already been raving about it to my friends, and it's a great introductory course. The pace is great, Professor Walton is extremely helpful and great at explaining, and you can tell that he has a passion for the language, which makes learning more enjoyable.
If you want to learn Biblical Hebrew at an introductory level, this is a great course to take.
